024af924-179c-41f5-bdb0-e3c8cd51e469.description: Earners of this badge have engaged in a Marine, Ocean, Environment, education activity delivered by Seadream Education CIC that enabled the earner to develop knowledge of marine biology and actively experience examination, observation, awareness, classification, biology and ecology of the marine environment. The activity encourages increased affinity with the marine environment and environmental stewardship.
024af924-179c-41f5-bdb0-e3c8cd51e469.name: Ocean Discovery Engager

issuer.summary: issued by Seadream Education CIC and authorized by Real Ideas Organisation

alignments.name: Cities of Learning Badge Standard - Engage Layer
alignments.description: This badge has been mapped to the Engage Layer of the Cities of Learning Badge Standard. Earners understand what's expected of them and are able to acquire information by actively experiencing learning.

badge_template_activities.title: Earners will have attended a marine environment education event run by Seadream Education CIC in either a school, a public space such as the library, waterfront or museum, or, with a group such as scouts, yacht club or cadets.
Earners will have heard information about the fascinating variety of marine life from the evidence washed up on the shore by each rhythmic tide.

Earners will have been told that an estimated 80% of all life on earth is found under the ocean surface, but that they don’t have to go under the ocean to discover many of its wonders. Shoreline finds are a great way to discover the ocean without getting wet and can even act as indicators of the effect of human activities on the planet, including pollution and climate change.
Earners will have been told how marine biologists use ocean finds to support their work.
Seadream Education CIC  The Water Tank,  Kingsbridge  Devon  TQ7 4HQE
